result.execSummary:
The defendant Cody J Oler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Cody J Oler is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Cody J Oler was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Cody J Oler was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Cody J Oler was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Cody J Oler was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*Huber for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow.

miscConds.notes:
*Pay costs
*Pay Domestic Abuse Surcharge
*Pay DNA Surcharge (DNA Surcharge NOT ordered in Counts 3, 4 & 5)
*If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
*Maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.
*Do not possess any firearms or other dangerous weapons.
*Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.

*No abusive contact with Kayla Perez or her family.
*Participate in any counseling or assessments as recommended by the agent.
*Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.
*Write letter of apology.
*Submit DNA sample.

Defendant Cody J Oler in court with attorney Ryan Drengler for 13CM160 & 13CM373 and attorney Anne Renc for 15CF430. Louis John Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 15CF430, 13CM160, 13CM373 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
13CM160 - NO CONTEST
13CM373 Count 2 - NO CONTEST
15CF430 Counts 2, 3, 4 & 5 - NO CONTEST 

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes. 

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 13CM160, 13CM373 Count 2, 15CF430 Counts 2 thru 5.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Dismissed & Read In:  13CM373 Count 1, 15CF430 Count 1 
Dismissed Outright:  15CF430 Count 6

Atty Molepske makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Renc makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
15CF430 Count 2 - 
150 days jail, STAYED
Huber for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow. 
Allowed to serve one half on electronic monitor if he qualifies at the time of the assessment. 
36 months probation: 
No abusive contact with Kayla Perez or her family. 
Participate in any assessment and counseling recommended by the agent.
Not possess dangerous weapons.  
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Maintain fulltime employment or school (if advisable by the agent) or combination for fulltime.
Write letter of apology. 
Serve 30 days jail. 
Credit for 34 days. 
Pay costs including the Domestic Abuse and DNA surcharges. 
Submit a DNA sample. 

15CF430 Count 3 - 
30 days jail, consecutive to Count 2, STAYED. 
Huber for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow. 
Allowed to serve one half on electronic monitor if he qualifies at the time of the assessment. 
36 months probation, concurrent with Count 2: 
Comply with all conditions except for the jail time, as ordered in Count 2. 
*Court does not order the DNA surcharge in Counts 3, 4 & 5*

15CF430 Count 4 - 
60 days jail, consecutive to Counts 2 & 3, STAYED
Huber for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow. 
Allowed to serve one half on electronic monitor if he qualifies at the time of the assessment. 
36 months probation, concurrent with Counts 2 & 3: 
Comply with all conditions as ordered in Count 3. 
Pay costs including the Domestic Abuse surcharge. 
*Court does not order the DNA surcharge in Counts 3, 4 & 5*

15CF430 Count 5 - 
30 days jail, consecutive to Counts 2, 3 & 4, STAYED
Huber for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow. 
Allowed to serve one half on electronic monitor if he qualifies at the time of the assessment. 
36 months probation, concurrent with Counts 2, 3 & 4: 
Comply with all conditions as ordered in Count 3. 
Pay costs including the Domestic Abuse surcharge. 
*Court does not order the DNA surcharge in Counts 3, 4 & 5*

13CM160 - 
30 days jail, consecutive to all other sentences, STAYED 
Huber for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow. 
Allowed to serve one half on electronic monitor if he qualifies at the time of the assessment. 
36 months probation: 
Conditions of probation are the same as 15CF430 Count 3. 
Pay a fine of $150 plus costs including the Domestic Abuse surcharge.

13CM373 - 
30 days jail, consecutive to all other sentences, STAYED 
Huber for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow. 
Allowed to serve one half on electronic monitor if he qualifies at the time of the assessment. 
36 months probation: 
Conditions of probation are the same as 15CF430 Count 3. 
Pay costs including the Domestic Abuse surcharge.

Defendant Cody J Oler in court with attorney Anne Renc. Louis John Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:31 AM Court calls case.
Atty Molepske states appearances. 
Victim also appears.

Matter is before the Court on a motion for modification of bond for Defendant to have contact with victim for purposes of child care issues.

Atty Renc addresses the Court, concurs, along with extra curricular events the children are in as well as medical issues.

Atty Molepske addresses the Court, vicitm does not object.

Victim addresses the Court, does not object for reasons stated on the record.
Victim did set up a safety plan through the family crisis center.

Matter is set for a plea on May 11th.

BY THE COURT:
Court grants motion.
